items.summary: Zero-calorie artificial sweetener ~600Ã— sweeter than sugar.
items.detail: Common in diet beverages, desserts, and protein powders. Stability under heat is debated; some studies discuss possible byproducts and microbiome impacts at high intake. Regulatory bodies set ADIs; overall safety depends on context and amount.

items.summary: White pigment/colorant used to brighten foods.
items.detail: EU banned its use in food (2022) over uncertainties about nanoparticle effects; still permitted in some regions with limits.

items.summary: Preservative used to inhibit microbial growth.
items.detail: May form benzene in presence of ascorbic acid under heat/light; typically controlled by formulation and storage.
